title: PAS rips up 'RM90m cheque' claim
text:
More 
PAS today said the picture of a cheque made out of RM90 million, said to prove claims the Islamist party received the funds from suspect sources, does not make sense. 
PAS vice-president Mohd Amar Abdullah said the picture now circulating on the internet showed an unsigned cheque which no bank would accept. 
"How can you cash and bank in a cheque if it is not signed? It would be very stupid of a bank to accept an unsigned cheque," he said in a recent ceramah in Besut, Terengganu. 
He was commenting on allegations made by former PAS vice-president Husam Musa that PAS received RM90 million from questionable sources.
